==Chinese==
{{zh-forms|s=亭长}}

===Etymology===
[[亭]] (an area of 10 square [[w:li (unit)|li]]) + [[長]] ([[leader]])
: During the [[w:Qin Dynasty|Qin]] and [[w:Han Dynasty|Han Dynasty]]s, there existed an administrative unit called a ting (亭), which was defined as an area of 10 square [[w:li (unit)|li]]. The leader of this rural district was called 亭長. The most famous former 亭長 was the [[w:Emperor Gaozu of Han|Emperor Gaozu of Han]].
